channel.title: {model editor/screenies} model editor
channel.description:
Yup, that's right, a model editor, the software's called Milkshape and [b]it's soon going to be able to read and export .mdl formats which RS can actually read[/b].
It will soon(hopefully when the new version comes out) export the models to a .mdl format (use the Quake I export for registered users), you can even import various models from games and software (Like 3DMax or 3D Studio), or even animate the models, here are screenies of MilkShape 3D:
[img]http://chumbalum.swissquake.ch/ms3d/ms3d1510_ss1.jpg[/img]
[img]http://chumbalum.swissquake.ch/ms3d/ms3d110_ss1.jpg[/img]
[img]http://chumbalum.swissquake.ch/ms3d/ms3d157_ss2.jpg[/img]
[img]http://chumbalum.swissquake.ch/ms3d/ms3d164_ss1.jpg[/img]
[img]http://chumbalum.swissquake.ch/ms3d/ms3d181b_ss1.jpg[/img]
[i]If you want you can [b][url=http://chumbalum.swissquake.ch/files/ms3d183.zip]DOWNLOAD[/url][/b] the old version which doesn't support the .mdl (or the RuneScape model extension) at the moment but you can use for other projects..[/i]

It will soon(hopefully when the new version comes out) export the models to a .mdl format (use the Quake I export for registered users), you can even import various models from games and software (Like 3DMax or 3D Studio), or even animate the models, here are screenies of MilkShape 3D:

If you want you can DOWNLOAD the old version which doesn’t support the .mdl (or the RuneScape model extension) at the moment but you can use for other projects…
